books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Harding’s Luck
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A poor orphan boy accidentally discovers magic which sends him into the past and leads to his recovery of a fortune and a lordly title.

books.title: A Midsummer Night’s Dream
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: This comedy follows four lovers and a thespian who become bewitched by fairies.

books.title: Titus Andronicus
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A blood feud erupts between a famous Roman general and the Queen of the Goths.

books.title: The Surprising Adventures of Baron Munchausen
books.author: Rudolph Erich Raspe
books.summary: The legendary Baron Munchausen’s tall tales of wonder and adventure.

books.title: Germinal
books.author: Émile Zola
books.summary: A new resident of a poor coal mining town in 1860s France begins learning about socialist principles, and convinces the town to go on strike.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: Wonderful Adventures of Mrs. Seacole in Many Lands
books.author: Mary Seacole
books.summary: A British Creole woman provides medical assistance during the Crimean War after her travels around Panama.

books.title: A Voice from the South
books.author: Anna Julia Cooper
books.summary: A Black woman from the American South philosophizes on various subjects.

books.title: Cane
books.author: Jean Toomer
books.summary: An experimental and highly lyrical novel exploring the African-American experience.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.

books.title: The Coming Race
books.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
books.summary: While exploring a mine, a man falls through a chasm into an underground world populated by a mysterious race.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: A collection of Herman Melville’s short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.
